question: 1) If one has a wetdream and the sheets of the bed are soaked with semen, and one does not wash the sheets and sits on it after it has dried
answer:
QUESTION
(1) If one has a wetdream and the sheets of the bed are soaked with semen, and one does not wash the sheets and sits on it after it has dried, then does his wudhu break and does his clothes become napaak?? (2) How long before sunrise can I perform Fajr. Sometimes i wake up late and am just able to finish my fard a few minutes before sunrise...is this ok or should I offer Fajr much earlier?? (3) What duaas/practices can i perform to help me achieve my aims in my studies??
ANSWER


Share:
1. If the sheets had dried completely and there is no semen left on the
sheets, then by sitting on the sheets, the clothes will not become Napaak,
and by sitting on such a sheet, the Wudhu will not break. (Hidaaya vol.1
pg.73)
2. It is permissible to perform Fajr Salaat till just before sunrise. If you
finish your Fardh of Fajr a few minutes before sunrise, the Fajr Salaat is
in order but is advisable to discharge the Fardh of Fajr Salaat together
with its Sunnats. (Hidaaya vol.1 pg.80)
3. Nabi (Sallallaahu Alayhi Wasallam) has taught us a very beautiful Du'aa,
'O Allah, we ask you of such knowledge which would be of benefit to us.' To
achieve your aim, a person has to be fully dedicated to his studies and at
the same time, make a lot of Du'aa to Allah Ta'ala to assist you in your
pursuance of knowledge.

and Allah Ta'ala Knows Best

Mufti Ebrahim Desai
